metadata.name: Asperatus 1
metadata.description:
World of Wonders  “Asperatus”

Asperitas, formerly known as Undulatus asperatus, is a distinctive, rare cloud formation that takes the appearance of rippling waves. These wave-like structures form on the underside of the cloud to make it look like a rough sea surface when viewed from below.

An encounter with these clouds is rare, I was lucky to be witness of it in 2015.  Ever since this experience, I keep looking up to the sky, always on a quest to catch time in minimalism and authenticity by witnessing all beauty created by nature.

The Netherlands - 2015 - 6000 x 3375 px  
Photographer Marieke Feenstra / marieke.nft  
World of Wonders photography collections
